Key Match Events: England needed to score 400 and managed only 170
South Africa batted with pugnacious excellence, laying the foundation with half-centuries before Heinrich Klaasen and Marco Jansen heaved the game away
Pre-Game Insights: England thrashed by South Africa: Cricket World Cup 2023 – as it happened
England had tried to refresh their side, making three changes to the team that lost to Afghanistan last Sunday
Post-Match Reflections: England’s hopes hang by thread after third defeat in four
The grisly picture is already clear: their old-timers thought this could be one last hurrah. Instead it has been a bridge too far.
Even Ben Stokes could not rescue them on this occasion: by the time he picked up his bat England already needed a miracle; he lasted eight balls.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Reece Topley suffered a finger injury in the seventh over
Adil Rashid suffered from a stomach upset
David Willey went down with cramp
Harry Brook called on the physio
Klaasen forced himself closer and closer to complete collapse; in the 47th over, the gymnastics required to evade a Mark Wood yorker left him on the ground and in obvious agony.
